identificationModule.briefTitle: The Energy Cost of 1-Hour Football Training
identificationModule.officialTitle: Energy Expenditure Induced by Football Training in Overweight Middle-aged Males

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims at investigating the energy expenditure following a single Football trainning session in middle aged males. The participants will perform a soccer training session \[A single training session including 60 minutes of warm up, soccer technical exercises and small-sided game\] and a cotrol trial (No intervention included, only daily measurements) in randomized, repeated measures, crossover design.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Football is an intermittent sport with frequent activity changes and a high number of explosive movements. As a result, both mitochondrial and the non-mitochondrial energy sources (phosphagens, lactic acid system) are heavily utilized during football practice and games, which may contribute to the rise of oxygen consumption following exercise (EPOC) compared with cardiovascular-type exercise, where VO2 can reach a steady state.However, it is observed that there is a methodological limitation in the determination of total energy expenditure during and after football training and specifically in overwight middle-aged participans with metabolic syndrome.

Twenty overweight middle-aged males with mtabolic syndrome will perform a soccer training session \[A single training session including 60 minutes of warm up, soccer technical exercises and small-sided game\] and a cotrol trial (No intervention included, only daily measurements) in randomized, repeated measures, crossover design. Anthropometric, biochmeistry indicators, metabolic, blood pressure, physical activity and performance measurements will be measured at baseline. Global positoning system and accelerometry devices will be used to measure the distance and intensity of football trianing. The metabolic cost will be estimated from heart rate, blood lactate, resting oxygen uptake, exercise oxygen uptake, and excess post-exercise oxygen consumption measurements using a portable gas analyzer.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Participants in this arm will receive no intervention

armGroups.label: Recreational Football Training
armGroups.description: Participants in this arm will participate in a football training session for 60 minutes. During the training the participans will execute the warm-up process, the part of soccer technical exercises and they will play a small-side-game.

interventions.name: FAM
interventions.description: Participants will perform a recreational Football Training session for 60 minutes. The training will include the warm-up, soccer technical exercises and a small-side game

primaryOutcomes.description: Exercise energy expenditure (kcal) will be measured using a portable indirect calorimetry system
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At pre-exercise, during, and post-exercise session (single bout lasting 60 minutes)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in excess post-exercise oxygen consumption (EPOC)
primaryOutcomes.description: EPOC (kcal) will be measured using a portable indirect calorimetry system
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At post-exercise session (single bout lasting 60 minutes)

primaryOutcomes.description: BLa (mmol/L) concentration will be measured in a microphotometer with commercially available kits.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At pre- and post-exercise session (single bout) at 3 minutes post-exercise

primaryOutcomes.description: Heart rate (bpm) will be measured with a wearable heart rate monitor
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At pre-exercise, during, and post-exercise session (single bout lasting 60 minutes)

primaryOutcomes.description: Rating of perceived exertion (RPE) will be measured with the Borg scale (0-10)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At pre-exercise and post-exercise session (single bout lasting 60 minutes)

primaryOutcomes.description: Respiratory Exchange Ratio (RER) will be measured using a portable indirect calorimetry system
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At pre-exercise, during, and post-exercise session (single bout lasting 60 minutes)

primaryOutcomes.description: Breath Frequency (BF) will be measured using a portable indirect calorimetry system
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At pre-exercise, during, and post-exercise session (single bout lasting 60 minutes)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Body weight will be measured on a beam balance with stadiometer
Body height will be measured on a beam balance with stadiometer
BMI will be calculated using the Quetelet's equation
WC (cm) will be measured using a Gullick II tape
HC (cm) will be measured using a Gullick II tape
WHR will be calculated by dividing the waist by the hip measurement
RMR (kcal) will be measured using a portable open-circuit indirect calorimeter with a ventilated hood system
Body fat (%) will be assessed by whole-body dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA)
FM (kg) will be assessed by whole-body dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA)
FFM (kg) will be assessed by whole-body dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA)
Bone mass density will be measured by using Dual-emission X-ray absorptiometry
Bone mass content will be measured by using Dual-emission X-ray absorptiometry
Peak VO2 will be estimated by open circuit spirometry via breath by breath method
Dietary intake will be assesed over a 7-day period using diet recalls

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Field activity during the soccer training
secondaryOutcomes.description: The field activity will be continuously monitored during the soccer training using global positioning system (GPS)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: [Time Frame: During the 60 minutes soccer training (ST) session (72 hours after baseline measurements)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Systolic Blood Pressure will be examined using sphygmomanometer
Dystolic Blood Pressure will be examined using sphygmomanometer
The rest heart rate will be estimated using a heart rate monitor

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Free of musculoskeletal injuries
* No use of ergogenic supplements or medication
* Free of chronic diseases
* age of 40-60 years
* BMI\>25
* Metabolic syndrome

Exclusion Criteria:

* Musculoskeletal injury
* Use of alcohol, caffeine and any type of ergogenic supplements or medication during the course of the study
